citeinfo.title: Changes in Anthropogenic Influences on Streams and Rivers: Crop Reserve Program

descript.abstract: This dataset consists of a table of data derived from the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) Farm Service Agency (FSA) Conservation Reserve Program (CRP), for Hydrologic Unit Code 10 (HUC-10) areas. The data represent the proportion of CRP acres to total cropland acres, based on county-level data, for the years 1986-2014.
descript.purpose: These data are intended to provide a framework in which watershed-specific studies of water quality in streams and rivers may be analyzed. The focus of the data is on anthropogenic changes over time.
descript.supplinf: One comma-separated text file is given here. The file contains a "uniqid" field, which is the link to the data in all other datasets in this product. Each file has 15,458 rows. The Conservation Reserve Program is "a land conservation program administered by the Farm Service Agency. In exchange for a yearly rental payment, farmers enrolled in the program agree to remove environmentally sensitive land from agricultural production and plant species that will improve environmental health and quality". (Farm Service Agency, 2015; https://www.fsa.usda.gov/programs-and-services/conservation-programs/conservation-reserve-program/). In this dataset, acres of CRP land were divided by total cropland to provide a ratio of CRP usage by county, then intersected with HUC-10 watersheds. Total cropland is a subset of total farmland. The calculations in this dataset represent watershed averages of county-level data (not allocated to land use pixels), for the HUC-10 watersheds. The data are identical for 1993 and 1994, as they were the same in the source data downloaded from the CRP website. It is unknown if this is intentional or not. HUC-10 boundaries were obtained on January 9, 2018 from the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) National Resources Conservation Service (NRCS) at https://nrcs.app.box.com/v/huc/folder/39640323180 (National Resources Conservation Service, 2017). References: Farm Service Agency (FSA), 2015, CRP enrollment and rental payments by county, 1986-2014 (xls), Conservation Reserve Program Statistics: Farm Service Agency, U.S. Department of Agriculture, available at https://www.fsa.usda.gov/programs-and-services/conservation-programs/conservation-reserve-program/index, accessed December 13, 2015. LaMotte, A.E., 2015. Selected items from the Census of Agriculture at the county level for the conterminous United States, 1950-2012. U.S. Geological Survey data release, http://dx.doi.org/10.5066/F7H13016. National Resources Conservation Service, 2017, Watershed boundary dataset (WBD): National Resources Conservation Service, U.S. Department of Agriculture, available at https://www.nrcs.usda.gov/wps/portal/nrcs/main/national/technical/nra/geo/, accessed January 9, 2018 from https://nrcs.app.box.com/v/huc/folder/39640323180.

srcinfo.srccontr: HUC-10 boundaries used in data calculations.

citeinfo.title: CRP enrollment and rental payments by county,l 1986-2014 (xls), Conservation Reserve Program Statistics

srcinfo.srccontr: Source digital tabular data from which acres of CRP data by county were extracted

citeinfo.title: Selected items from the Census of Agriculture at the county level for the conterminous United States, 1950-2012

srcinfo.srccontr: Tabular county data with number of acres of total farmland and number of acres of total cropland for each Census of Agriculture collection year. The values for total farmland by county by year are found in the "farms" folder, in the file farms.txt, as the attribute fXXXX002 (Land in farms, acres). The values for total cropland by county by year are found in the "landuse" folder, in the file tcrop.txt, as the attribute aXXXX008 (Acres of total cropland). A small number of counties with "Withheld" values of total cropland were filled from adjacent years.

procstep.procdesc: (1) Tabular data of CRP acreage by county was downloaded from https://www.fsa.usda.gov/programs-and-services/conservation-programs/reports-and-statistics/conservation-reserve-program-statistics/index

(2) Data were joined to county boundaries from LaMotte (2017). Census of Agriculture number of acres of total farmland and number of acres of total cropland for each county were extracted from LaMotte (2015), for the years 1987, 1992, 1997, 2002, 2007, and 2012, and joined to the county boundaries.

(3) The proportion of cropland in CRP acres by county was calculated by dividing the CRP acreage for a year by the Census of Agriculture (CoA) farmland or cropland acres (LaMotte, 2015) for the year nearest in time. That is, 1986 through 1989 CRP acres were divided by the CoA acres for 1987, 1990 through 1994 were divided by the CoA acres for 1992, 1995 through 1999 were divided by the CoA acres for 1997, 2000 through 2004 were divided by the CoA acres for 2002, 2005 through 2009 were divided by the CoA acres for 2007, and 2010 through 2014 were divided by the CoA acres for 2012.
(4) One-kilometer resolution rasters were created from the county boundaries and associated proportion values.
(5) HUC-10 watershed proportion of land in CRP was calculated using the zonalmean() command in ArcGIS Grid.

enttyp.enttypd: Data consist of a comma-separated text file. There is one table: crp-huc10.txt
enttyp.enttypds: Surface Water Trends project, USGS National Water Quality Program

attr.attrdef: Proportion of total cropland acreage which is enrolled in the Crop Reserve Program, for year XXXX (1986-2014)
